pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:0.5: 49. The training rule on staying with armies
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.2: the monks from the group of six went to the army on some business, and they stayed there for more than three nights.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics stay with the army?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.5: It’s our misfortune that we must stay with the army for the sake of our livelihood and because of our wives and children.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.6: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.7: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.8: “How can the monks from the group of six stay with the army for more than three nights?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.12: “… Foolish men, how can you stay with the army for more than three nights?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.13: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.14: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:1.15.1: ‘If that monk has a reason for going to the army, he may stay with the army for two or three nights. If he stays longer than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.1: If that monk has a reason for going to the army:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.2: if he has a reason, if he has something to be done.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.3: He may stay with the army for two or three nights:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.4: he may stay for two or for three nights.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.5: If he stays longer than that:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.1.6: if he is staying with the army at sunset on the fourth day, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.1: If it is more than three nights, and he perceives it as more, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.2: If it is more than three nights, but he is unsure of it, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.3: If it is more than three nights, but he perceives it as less, and he is staying with the army, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.4: If it is less than three nights, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.5: If it is less than three nights, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.2.6: If it is less than three nights, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.2: if he stays for two or three nights;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.3: if he stays for less than two or three nights;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.4: if he stays for two nights, then leaves before dawn on the third night, and then stays again;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.5: if he stays because he is sick;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.6: if he stays because there is something to be done for someone who is sick;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.7: if the army is obstructed by an enemy army;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.8: if he is obstructed from leaving;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.11: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc49:2.3.12: The ninth rule, the training rule on staying with armies, is finished.
